entry.title: Re: ABAP RAP - Date field value help with future dates di...
entry.content:
You can use Property maxDate.

Now the question as to how to set this property in Fiori Elements (I am assuming you've created an Elements App) - You have to extend the app and like below code you can achieve it. The below code is just for reference and might have to tweak a little.

sap.ui.define([
  "sap/ui/core/mvc/ControllerExtension"
], function(ControllerExtension) {
  "use strict";

  return ControllerExtension.extend("your.app.ext.controller.ObjectPageExt", {
    override: {
      onAfterRendering: function() {
        var oDatePicker = this.base.getView().byId("YourEntity::BookingDate::Field-input"); 
        if (oDatePicker) {
          oDatePicker.setMaxDate(new Date()); // Today as max
        }
      }
    }
  });
});

entry.title: Re: Access Denied to SAP SuccessFactors Process Library
entry.content:
hi 

Why You're Seeing "Access Denied" ?
This typically happens due to one of the following:
• Missing Role or Permission: Even with a paid subscription, you may not have the correct access role assigned to view the Process Library.
• Account Group Restrictions: The Process Library is shared on a per-account-group basis. If your account isn't part of the right group, access will be blocked.
• Migration Issues: Some users lost access after SAP migrated content to new community platforms.
• Login Confusion: You might be logged into the SAP Help Portal or Community with a different account than your subscription one.

Steps to Gain Access
1. Confirm Your SAP Account Type
• Make sure you're using the same SAP account linked to your paid subscription.
• If you're unsure, log out and log back in using your subscription credentials.
2. Request Access via SAP Support
• Open a support ticket through the SAP Support Portal.
• Mention that you're a paid learner and include:
• Your SAP ID
• Subscription type
• Screenshot of the error
• URL of the blocked page
3. Check with Your Learning Administrator
• If you're part of a corporate learning group, your admin may need to assign you to the correct account group to access the Process Library

Regards

Surjith

entry.title: Re: Manual Settlement in Sales Rebate
entry.content: Yes RES2 is designed to reverse the previous settled amounts during final settlement. In standard logic, it adds back the partial settlement amount as a negative value, assuming the final settlement will recalculate the full rebate. This behavior is correct for true partial settlements, but not for prepayments or deposits. So in order to meet your requirement that is the manual settlement amount to perform as a deduction, you can have a custom condition type with Plus/Minus = A. This way, the deposit appears as a positive value, reducing the final rebate amount.

Are you talking about Subtotal at Sales Order level? or you want to only display 1 entry for 1 sales order with cumulated figures? please provide clear requirement.

entry.title: Re: Interfaces IF_EDOC_SOURCE_EXTENSION & IF_EDOC_SOURCE_...
entry.content:
Hello @Vynerfes 

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition, you cannot flip the Relevant flag or force manual creation for a delivered source type through your own classes. The two interfaces, IF_EDOC_SOURCE_EXTENSION and IF_EDOC_SOURCE_PROCESS_EXT, are only acknowledged by the framework when the source type is explicitly enabled for customer extension by SAP. In Public Cloud, that switch Source Ext. Active in SSCUI 102190 is not exposed to customers, which is why your classes are not being called.

A few points to clarify what you are seeing.

SSCUI 102190 – Source Ext. Active missing
In Public Cloud, this checkbox isn’t available to customers. Activation is managed by SAP. If it is not active for the source type, such as RE_INVOICE, RE_DOC, etc., the extension callbacks won’t be triggered.

CL_EDOCUMENT not released
Correct. That’s another sign the core generation class isn’t open for customer enhancement in Public Cloud. You can register your own classes in “Register Handling Classes for Source Extensions”, but unless the source type is whitelisted and “Source Ext. Active” is on, the framework will not dispatch to them.

Relevant indicator
In Public Cloud, relevance is determined by SAP’s delivered relevance logic for each supported process and country. It is not intended to be overridden to make an unsupported object, like CLM invoices, an eDocument capable.

  • Why your classes aren’t called. Although you set API state C1 (Use System-Internally) and registered the classes.
  • The dispatcher verifies the activation flag based on source type or company code. Since that flag isn’t customer-configurable in Public Cloud, your implementations are skipped.

What you should do (Recommendation)

  • Use a supported source or process for customer billing, like SD billing or FI-AR invoice, and let DRC generate the eDocument from that standard object. If CLM produces the commercial invoice, route it to a supported billing object that DRC understands.
  • If there is a genuine legal requirement for CLM as a source, open an incident with SAP, commonly used component: LO-GLO-EDOC or country-specific component, requesting enablement or a roadmap. That is currently the only way to activate Source Ext. Active for a delivered source type in Public Cloud

SAP Help Portal – Enabling a Source Type for a Process

SAP Help – App Extensibility: eDocument Cockpit and Manage Electronic Documents

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Provisión ISN
entry.content:
hi 

Possible Causes:-

1) Missing Configuration in Table V_T7MX18
This table defines the ordinary base for ISN calculation.
If the new subdivisions aren’t included here, the system won’t calculate the tax.
2) Payroll Wage Types Not Included in ISN Base
You need to verify that the wage types used in payroll are correctly classified to be part of the ISN base.
Use report RPDLGA20 to check how wage types are categorized (especially under processing class 61).
3) Incomplete SPRO Configuration
Go to:
SPRO > IMG > Payroll > Payroll Mexico > Taxes > State Tax (ISN)
Make sure the new subdivisions are included in all relevant configuration steps.
Incorrect Assignment of Personnel Areas or Cost Centers
Even if V_001P_ALL looks correct, the fiscal assignment might be incomplete or misaligned.

 

What You Can Do? 

Check table V_T7MX18 using transaction SM31 and confirm the new subdivisions are listed.
Run report RPDLGA20 to verify wage types are correctly marked for ISN.
Review SPRO configuration for ISN and ensure all new subdivisions are included.
If you're in a state where ISN is calculated globally (like Campeche or Hidalgo), make sure the system is set to calculate it at the company level, not per employee.

Regards

Surjith

entry.title: Re: How can the filters of story hyperlinks inserted thro...
entry.content:
Hi @7susan9 

Thank you for your question. Let me walk you through.

In SAP Analytics Cloud, when you jump from one Story to another via a hyperlink, the target story opens with its own default filters. By default, the system does not automatically transfer filter values from the source story.

However, SAP provides a way to achieve your requirement through URL filter parameters.

Here is how you can pass filters with Hyperlinks

Construct the Hyperlink with URL Parameters (Configuring URL Parameters)

    • In the text box, instead of only entering the Story link, append URL parameters that set the filter values dynamically. Make sure that the f[DateDimension] sets the filter for the dimension DateDimension to 2025. Variable Parameters

Consider using multiple filters because you can pass multiple filters by chaining parameters (e.g., ?f[DateDimension]=2025&f[Region]=EMEA)

You can use Parameter Rules, please note that filter parameters must use the technical names of the dimensions/measures as defined in your model. The supported operators include =, !=, <, >, and ranges (e.g. 2020:2025).

When using responsive Pages, this method works the same for responsive pages. The hyperlink passes the filter values before the story is rendered, so the user lands in the story with the correct filters pre-applied.

The following reference provides more detail

Story URL Parameters

I hope this provides the desired insights. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: No Super Admin available for SAP For Me
entry.content:
Hello team, 

The only super admin user available in SAP for Me is no longer available. We need to include other users as super admins, one from the client and one from our side, as implementation partners.

Could you pls suggest how to set up new Super User for such situation?

Thanks


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: No Super Admin available for SAP For Me
entry.content:
Dear customer,

If the only super user in your company is not available any longer, then the user admins or cloud admins (if available) can set up new super user(s) using the Copy Authorization feature as introduced in KBA 1614304.

But the user admin or cloud admin cannot set their own S-user as the new Super User using this feature. Refer to KBA 2399897.

In case there is no any available user admin or cloud admin either, then feel free to contact SAP by submitting a case using component XX-SER-FORME, indicating the new Super user S-IDs. 

Hope this helps.

Thanks and regards,
SAP Support

entry.title: SLALITTYPEs for Ordinary Depreciation Related to Current / Prior Year Acquisition
entry.content:
Purpose

SLALITTYPE stands for Subledger-Specific Line Item Type. Together with MOVCAT (Transaction Type Category), it tells you the business meaning of current line item. Experienced users are very familiar with SLALITTYPEs. However, some other users still ask about it from time to time. So, it is worth an article to give some more explanation.

This article starts with the concepts of SLALITTYPE and MOVCAT, and then gives you a couple of examples to explain you how they work together.

⚠️To make the explanation easier, this article mainly focuses on the SLALITTYPEs for ordinary depreciation, because it is most commonly used. Special depreciation works in a similar way,

SLALITTYPEs for Acquisition

Every fixed asset starts its useful life with an acquisition. This article starts from here too. The most commonly used SLALITYPEs for acquisitions are:

  • 7000 - Cumulative Acquisition Costs
  • 7040 - Acquisition Costs for Current Year

⚠️All SLALITTYPEs from Asset Accounting start with 07.  

SLALITTYPEs for Ordinary Depreciation

SLALITTYPEs for ordinary depreciation has a coding convesion in the suffix, as you might have already noticed. For example:

SLALITTYPE SuffixStand For
5Ordinary Depreciation
6Special Depreciation
7Unplanned Depreciation

The following SLALITTYPEs related to ordinary depreciation are most frequently used.

  • 07005: Cumulative Ordinary Depreciation
  • 07025: Ordinary Depreciation Related to Prior Year Acquisition
  • 07045: Ordinary Depreciation Related to Current Year Acquisition
  • 07205: Ordinary Depreciation, Posted Periodically

SLALITTYPEs and Transaction Type Category (MOVCATs)

A SLALITTYPE can tell you the type of depreciation in the current line-item. But it does not tell you which transaction this depreciation amount relates to. For this purpose, you need Transaction Type Category (MOVCAT) in addition.

Here is a list of most frequently used MOVCATs.

  • 00 Balance Carry-Forward (BCF)
  • 06 Depreciation Run
  • 11 Acquisition
  • 12 Retirement
  • 13 Transfer Acquisition
  • 14 Transfer Retirement
  • 15 Post-Capitalization
  • 46 Manual Depreciation
  • 65 Revaluation

You will find more details in the rest of this article about how the SLALITTYPEs work together with MOVCATs.

SLALITTYPE 07205

07205 is only used in depreciation posting. That is to say, the T-Code AFAB posts ordinary depreciations with this SLALITTYPE 07205. And that is why in most cases the corresponding MOVCAT is 06 (Depreciation Run).

SLALITTYPE 07025 and 07045

Both SLALITTYPEs are used for value adjustments in ordinary depreciations, which are related to corresponding transactional postings. Again, you should look at the MOVCAT to know which business transaction it is in the current line item.

For example, you may find the following combinations of MOVCATs and SLALITTYPEs in your line items. 

MOVCATSLALITTYPEMeaning
11 (Acquisition)07025 Value Adjustment in Ordinary Depreciation, related to the (gross) acquisition in the prior year
12 (Retirement)07045Value Adjustment in Ordinary Depreciation, related to the retirement in the current year

Someone may take 07025 as an ordinary depreciation posted in the prior year, and 07045 as the one posted in the current year. This understanding is completely wrong!

As their descriptions suggest, 07025 and 07045 are different in the relations to their acquisitions. If a depreciation is calculated based on the acquistion of current year, system uses 07045. Otherwise, 07025 is taken.

SLALITTYPE 07005

It stands for accumulated ordinary depreciation. When it is combined with different MOVCATs, the current line item has different meanings. For example:

MOVCATMeaning
00 (Balance Carry-Forward)Accumulated Ordinary Depreciation at fiscal year start, carried-forward from the prior year.
11 (Acquisition)Value Adjustment in Ordinary Depreciation, related to the (gross) acquisition in the prior year
12 (Retirement)Value Adjustment in Ordinary Depreciation, related to the retirement in the prior year

Example - Gross Acquisition

Let's say a company code has two open fiscal years: 2024 & 2025. And the fiscal year variant is K4, meaning fiscal year aligned with calendar year.

The requirement is to post the following gross acquisition:

  • Date for gross acquisition 2025-07-01.
  • Prior year APC: 12,000 EUR
  • Prior year posted depreciation: -1,200 EUR
  • Current year depreciation (up to end of Jun 2025): -600 EUR

Enter the following line items in the T-code AB01 with transaction type 158, and with the posting date 2025-07-01.

SLALITTYPEMOVCATAmountRemarks
07000 - Cumulative APC1112,000 EURThe APC is from the prior year 2024.
07005 - Cumulative Ordinary Depr.11-1,200 EURThe depreciation is from the prior year 2024 (up to 2024-12-31)
07025 - Ordinary Depr. Related to Prior Year Acquisition11-600 EUR

This depreciation is for the 1st half of 2025.
But it is related to the acquisition from 2024.

⚠️There is no line item for 07045 at all. Because this acqusition is not for current year 2025. 

Example - Full Retirement (Scrapping)

Again, our company code has two open fiscal years: 2024 & 2025. And the fiscal year variant is K4, meaning fiscal year aligned with calendar year.

We have an asset with the depreciation key LINS:

  • It is a straight-line depreciation.
  • The depreciation is based on netbook value (NBV) over the remaining useful life.

This asset has 10 years' useful life and two acquisitions:

ACQ #1 - 2024 (prior year)With APC amount 1,200 EUR

ACQ #2 - 2025 (current year)

With APC amount 2,400 EUR

The ordinary depreciations in 2024 and 2025 are calculated as following. 

YearBase Value (Year-Start) Annual Ordinary DepreciationNBV (Year-End)
20241,200 EUR-120 EUR1,080 EUR
20253,480 EUR
=2,400 + 1,080		-387 EUR
= 3,480 / 9  (9 years left)		3,093 EUR

Now scrap the whole asset on Apr. 1 of 2025 (T-Code ABAVL). And you will see how different SLALITTYPEs are used in the following line items.

 SLALITTYPEMOVCATAmountRemarks
Retire 2024 - ACQ #10700012-1,200 EUR 
Retire 2024 - ACQ #10700512    120 EUR 
Retire 2025 - ACQ #10702512      30 EUR1/4 of 120 (Depreciation related to ACQ #1 from prior year 2024)
Retire 2025 - ACQ #20704012-2,400 EUR 
Retire 2025 - ACQ #20704512      67 EUR1/4 of 267 (= 387-120, Depr. related to ACQ #2 from current year 2025)

SLALITTYPE and Posting Schema

Posting schema is another complex topic. It is too much to describe it here too. But is worth mentioning how a SLALITTYPE is derived from a posting schema.

Run the t-code ABUZSM and you will find lots of pre-defined posting schema. For example, SAP_100_001 is for acquisition. There you will find the first line item as following.

With this schema, posting kernle will do the following:

  • Symbolic account KTANSW will be mapped to a G/L account via account determination.
  • Symbolic amount 01 will be mapped to a SLALITTYPE
    • If it is an acquisition for current year, the SLALITTYPE is 7040.
    • If it is an acquisition for prior year, the SLALITTYPE is 7000.

Summary

SLALITTYPE and MOVCAT are very important in Asset Accounting. It will be especially helpful when you want to build your asset reporting with your own-tailored key figures.

here Material B

entry.title: Re: Implementing Push Notifications
entry.content:
I compared it with our own config where it works fine.

Following differences I could find:

  • In your code getCustomNotificationEvents has a function parameter sTopic. In our implementation and in the guideline it has no parameter. Maybe therefore the function override is not working.
  • Our subscription in the process is to plant, work center and resource. In yours only to plant and work center.

In addition, ensure that POD notifications are enabled in the POD designer https://help.sap.com/docs/sap-digital-manufacturing/pod-plugin-developer-s-guide/implementing-push-notifications?locale=en-US

entry.title: Re: PRICING
entry.content: Before deletion, make sure the table is not assigned to any access sequence. You can check via V/07, No condition records exist and it is not used in any pricing procedure. Next go to V/03, to change condition tables, Input the condition table number you want to delete and finally, from the top menu, choose Condition → Delete

entry.title: Unlocking the Potential of SAP AI in Procurement
entry.content:
Hello, Martin Beganyi here again, Program Lead at Procurement Adoption Office.  

You may know me from my previous contributions as part of the Solution Value Advisory team for EMEA/MEE.

Recently, I have transitioned to the newly established Procurement Adoption Office, where I now lead two global adoption programs: one focused on driving the adoption of SAP Ariba’s Category Management solution, and the second dedicated to accelerating the uptake of AI-powered features across SAP Procurement solutions, specifically SAP Fieldglass and SAP Ariba - This blog is dedicated to the latter, the transformative role of SAP AI in Procurement. 

Through years, I’ve observed a consistent challenge: many organizations are unaware of the full suite of AI capabilities embedded in their SAP procurement solutions.  Despite the growing availability of these advanced features, adoption remain low or inconsistent, limiting the value customers can unlock. 

To address this, we have launched a global program to help customers to adopt AI features in core solutions for example, Strategic Sourcing, Fieldglass, and Buying. 

Introducing the AI Toolkit 

The cornerstone of our initiative is the AI Toolkit — a concise, easy-to-understand resource that compiles essential information about all available AI functionalities.  Designed for those new to AI, the toolkit cuts through the noise of overwhelming information, providing a clear starting point for customers and partners alike.  We encourage you to download, share, and leverage this toolkit within your teams:   

  • AI in Procurement Toolkit (Aug2025).pdf 

Engage with Our Interactive Learning Opportunities 

To further support adoption, we host a series of live webinars where we delve into the value of individual AI features, demonstrate activation steps, and showcase practical usage scenarios. Here are some of the upcoming sessions: 

  • Registration for On24 Sessions 

For our Preferred Success customers, we can offer a dedicated one-on-one expert led engagements, including hands-on activation of AI features aligned with your business needs. 

Join Our Open Office Hours 

Additionally, we run a recurring series of ‘Open’ hour to all SAP customers which offers a flexible way to ask questions, seek real-time answers, and gain clarity on AI capabilities. 

Upcoming ‘Open’ hours (EMEA/APAC): 

  • Sept 9th - Open Hour (EMEA/APAC)​ 
  • Sept 23rd - Open Hour (EMEA/APAC)​ 
  • Oct 7th – Open Hour (EMEA/APAC)​ 
  • Oct 21st – Open Hour (EMEA/APAC)​ 
  • Nov 4th – Open Hour (EMEA/APAC)​ 
  • Nov 18h – Open Hour (EMEA/APAC)​ 
  • Dec 2nd – Open Hour (EMEA/APAC)​ 
  • Dec 16th – Open Hour (EMEA/APAC) 

Next Steps 

We invite you to explore our AI Toolkit, participate in the webinars, or attend the SAP ‘Open’ hours.  To schedule a dedicated session tailored to your organization’s needs, please reach out to your Customer Success Manager who can support you. 

Thank you for your time and interest in advancing procurement with AI.  Together, we can unlock new efficiencies and drive strategic value across your supply chain. 

Best regards, 

Martin Beganyi

entry.title: Re: Navigating the Future: Understanding Upcoming Changes to SAP Universal ID
entry.content:
@ThomasHiesener @pmuschick 
Well, a privately owned Universal ID gave access to companys' business assets. With the creation of Service Requests functionality for Rise and the functionality to create BTP admins out of me.sap.com, a company's public cloud security fully relied on private IT. No control on customer side. No compliance. Ooops.
So the main feature - SSO - was the bug.

What SAP misses in all this advertisements about the change is this simple statement:

  • The Universal ID (P-user) is used for community.sap.com and nowhere else.
  • Everything business related needs to be done with S-user.

I don'ts see a reason yet, why I should link a new S-User to a Universal ID now. Does someone do? 

My practical recommendations:

  • Create a passport (client certificate) for each S-User you own and use the browsers' certificate selector dialog as an S-User account selector. Use this link to create the passport: https://me.sap.com/app/sappassport 
  • Activate MFA for your S-Users as S-Users have access to more sensitive functionality than most people think. Use link https://accounts.sap.com/ui/protected/profilemanagement to do so. At least Super-Admins, User-Admins and Cloud Admins should do so immediately. But even creating cases for public cloud must be considered sensitive - BTP Cockpit access anyway. There is a flag to persist ("Remember") the MFA login session and I would use it on well secured and trusted business hardware to not have to do MFA-Login all the time.
  • Use multiple browser profiles (e.g. by Customer name) to separate multiple parallel login sessions

Cheers, Lutz

entry.title: Re: Fiscal Year and Posting Period

If you want to control automatically, couple of custom validations are there. One is in OB28, you can create a custom validation like "BKPF-BUDAT < '15.04.2025" by which you can trigger an error message. Next option is in OBA5, as like F5192 which is to restrict posting in future date, you can create a new one for back date restriction.

entry.title: Re: Settelment Management with multiple scale level for m...
entry.content:
Not sure, how you set up your Scale type which should be Base Scale. It should not be Graduated or Fixed amount. Also check that the scale basis is set to value, not quantity. The issue could also be due to Material Group, that is if the system is combining Material A and B under the same condition record due to same material group, it might apply the scale cumulatively.

Go to Condition Record and ensure the following:

  • Scale type = Base Scale
  • Scale basis = Value
  • Threshold = €500

Use report WB2R_BVDETAIL to inspect how the business volume was calculated. Check if Material B was evaluated independently or as part of a group.

Finally, run a test settlement with only Material B to confirm whether the scale threshold is respected.

entry.title: UI5 Application works from BAS, but from HTML5 Repo, it gives 404 Error
entry.content:
Hi There,

Good day !
We are migrating our exiting Freestyle Ui5 applications from NEO to CF.

As part of migration process, we imported the app in BAS, configured oData destination, prefix etc.
The app and oData calls work when running it from BAS.

When deploy from BAS to CF, we could see the app in HTML5 repository, also 3 service instances with 4 service keys altogather.
When I try to run the app from CF (HTml5 Repo, app URL link), I get 404 errors for metadata load, and thus the app load is failing.
Following several answers in checked mta, ui5.yaml etc from web, I did removed "/" prefix, applied prefix etc, nothing worked.

I did check, the backend destination, path, prefix, url in ui5.yaml didn't find anything wrong.
The difference I see in metadata call is

From BAS successful : https://port8080-workspaces-ws-xl2uw.XXXXXX.applicationstudio.cloud.sap/<Neodestination prefix>/odata/<serviceName>/$metadata?sap-client=500&sap-language=EN

From HTML5 Repo un-successful: https://cloudfoundry-<XXXXX>.launchpad.cfapps.<XXXXX>..hana.ondemand.com/<GUID>.<APPNAME>.<APPNAME>-<Version#>/<Neodestination prefix>/odata/sap/<serviceName>/$metadata?sap-language=6N

Tried multiple ways of splicing the failed url removing app name etc, nothing worked

Not sure what am I doing wrong.

Any help in this regard is highly appreciated.

 

Thank you,

Sai

entry.title: Re: How can SAP BO send emails with SMTP certificate
entry.content:
The procedure is the same for Linux, AIX, and Solaris.
For AIX, the corresponding installation directory is <INSTALLDIR>/sap_bobj/enterprise_xi40/aix_rs6000_64/

Note: On 4.3 SP03 and higher, the certificate.crt must be converted to certificate.pse

see KBA  2540416 - How to set up SMTP over SSL, BI 4.2SP04+


For TCP communication, ensure that the required port is open in your firewall configuration

Refer to the "Troubleshooting" section in the same KBA mentioned above to verify port connectivity

entry.title: Re: Best Practice for data transfer between EPLAN and SAP...
entry.content:
Hello @JuliaLu 

Thank you for your follow-up. The term E-plan can refer to different things, so the suitable API depends on your process context.

Maintenance Plan (EAM) – the most typical use case of the E-plan

  • API: API_MAINTENANCEPLAN to read, create, update maintenance plans, items, cycles, and schedules.
  • Communication Scenario: SAP_COM_0396 EAM OData Integration.
  • If your plan category is Service Order, you will also need SAP_COM_0350.

Project Plan (EPPM)

If you are referring to a project or WBS plan, the relevant APIs are part of the EPPM suite, such as API_EVENT_BASED_REVREC_PROJECT_SRV for event-based postings, or WBS/Project Definition APIs depending on the specific object.

EPLAN CAD Integration

S/4 HANA Public Cloud doesn’t offer a built-in EPLAN API. Common integrations utilise.

  • Document Info Record (DIR) APIs for drawings specification 
  • Material BOM or Production Routing APIs for structures.

How to connect via BTP Integration Suite

  • In S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, create a Communication Arrangement for the relevant scenario SAP_COM_0396
  • Consume the OData service URL in SAP Integration Suite (Cloud Integration) via the OData V2 adapter.

Check Below SAP Documentation for your references  and let me know if it works

SAP Help Portal – Communication Scenarios in S/4HANA Cloud

SAP API Business Hub – Maintenance Plan (A2X) API

SAP Learning-Working with Technical Aspects 

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Integrated Financial Planning OPEX Cost Rates Data Ac...
entry.content:
Dear @SANA11,

the data action Calculate CCtr Activity Cost Rates with Account-Based Split calculates the cost rates and split them based on the account mapping maintained in your G/L Account master data (property Allocation Account). This is described in our documentation

To do this, we first aggregate all debit amounts to G/L account = # (line 40) and this amount is copied to the maintained allocation account (line 42). 

DATA([d/Measures] = #M2, [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT] = [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT].[p/ALLOCATION_ACCOUNT])

Line 43 checks the result of line 42. If there is  a valid allocation account maintained, @Default_Alloc_Account_Exists = 1. If there is an invalid or no allocation account maintained @Default_Alloc_Account_Exists = NULL. 

So if your result is NULL, there might be an invalid or no allocation account maintained in your master data.

The second part of the formula you mention is needed for the iterative calculation of the cost rate. The variable which is used for this calculation has to be set to 0 after each calculation cycle, otherwise the debit amount would be summed up with each calculation cycle. 

Best regards
Susanne

entry.title: Re: Restrict Access of OAuth2.0 Clients with the Technical User purpose
entry.content:
@Thibault_dockx  from the official documentation seems limited to restricted operation:

  • A Technical User purpose:
    • To use the SCIM 2.0 API (see Create Users and Assign Them to Roles via the SCIM 2.0 API).
    • To transport content (see Transporting Your Content through SAP Cloud Transport Management and api/v1/content in the SAP Analytics Cloud REST API Guide).
    • To export a log of user activities to a CSV file (see api/v1/audit/activities/exportActivities in the SAP Analytics Cloud REST API Guide).
    • To allow SAP Signavio to connect securely to SAP systems such as SAP S/4HANA (see SAP Signavio Connections.)
    • To use thedataspherecommand line interface (marketplacecommands only). SeeManage the Data Marketplace via the Command Line

Is there any way to access to CLI with technical User for all the functionality?

Riccardo

Functionnality has been added in the SAP Roadmap (for On-premise too !)

FUTURE RELEASE
Planned for Q4 2025

Creation of sales orders with reference to a predecessor document using the SAP Fiori app “Import Sales Orders”

Products:
    • SAP S/4HANA
 
Focus Topics:
    • User Experience
 

Overview

  • Use the Import Sales Orders app to support the creation of sales orders with reference to a predecessor document, such as a sales contract

Benefits

entry.title: Re: Creating QR codes in B1 HANA
entry.content:
Yes, we figured eventually that we need to create parameters without percentage sign.

Also, another point if some looks this up in the future - since HANA is case sensitive, it's an important information that B1 calls the procedure without double quotes, meaning procedure name should be in uppercase or without double quotes:

CREATE PROCEDURE TmSp_QRCodeSPGenerated_XX_13 - works

CREATE PROCEDURE TMSP_QRCODESPGENERATED_XX_13 - works

CREATE PROCEDURE "TmSp_QRCodeSPGenerated_XX_13" - doesn't work

entry.title: Re: Can you tell me what authoirzation is missing for this SU53 screenshot
entry.content: Added Security tag for better reach

entry.title: Re: Integrated Financial Planning OPEX Cost Rates Data Ac...
entry.content:
Hi SANA11,

please see the comment above the line:
// Copy total amount to default allocation account
With the account based split, expense accounts are mapped to allocation accounts via a mapping using the attribute "Allocation Account" of the dimension SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT. The default allocation account is stored in this attribute for the G/L account "#". This is used, when the allocation account attribute of the respective expense account is not maintained.

The code line you mentioned only is a preparation for the next line:
@Default_Alloc_Account_Exists = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = #M2) * 0 + 1
With this trick one can calculate if a default allocation account exists (@Default_Alloc_Account_Exists = 1) or not (@Default_Alloc_Account_Exists = Null)
If the line before is empty as in your case, no default allocation account exists.

This trick is used, because there is not other way in the advanced formula to check if the attribute of certain memeber value is maintained or not.

Please also check out the documentation of the data action:
Go to 
https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_ON-PREMISE/48f4b4785b8e45938ac44a67be8032d9/5b0222d10acd4cc7b6678aee90ee11b1.html?locale=en-US

and click on the respective data action in the process overview diagram.

Best regards
Hartmut

entry.title: Re: how to exclude specific price condition type from cha...
entry.content:
SAP doesn’t offer a direct checkbox to exclude condition types from COND_A, but you can achieve this through a combination of custom filtering and enhancement techniques. Try with BAdI CHANGE_POINTERS_READ or enhancement spot SXS_CHNGPNT to intercept and control which condition types should trigger change pointers. Discuss with ABAP team, explain your requirement so that, they can insert the required logic in the above areas.
The other option is to consider ALE Filtering. If you're distributing condition records via IDocs COND_A01, you can use ALE filters to exclude specific condition types during outbound processing. Go to BD64 (Distribution Model) and use filter objects to restrict by condition type (KSCHL).

entry.title: Re: what are the activities to perform as a FIORI Consult...
entry.content:
That's such a generic question that it's actually perfect for ChatGPT. Here is an AI-generated overview with resources linking directly to SAP pages with further information.

 

1) Pre-upgrade discovery & planning

Baseline current apps & roles: export your app IDs, catalogs, groups, and identify custom UI5 apps and classic UIs (SAP GUI for HTML, Web Dynpro).

Run upgrade impact analysis: use the SAP Fiori Apps Reference Library → Upgrade Impact Analysis to see what changes in 2023 (how it works, blog walkthrough).

Include Readiness Check (Upgrades): leverage the “App Availability” check that integrates Upgrade Impact Analysis (overview).

Plan Spaces & Pages: classic Home Page (Groups) is deprecated; plan migration to Spaces/Pages (why & how).

UI5 version target: Validate custom apps against SAPUI5 1.120 (LTS) commonly aligned with S/4HANA 2023. See UI5 1.120 info and version maintenance overview.

2) Design decisions before cutover

Replace obsolete/deprecated apps: map each deprecated app to its successor and update catalogs/roles (guidance: SAP Fiori for S/4HANA topic page → “Upgrade Faster” series).

Manage content with FLP Content Manager: prefer Launchpad Content Manager over Designer; it supports upgrade workflows (FLPCM app).

Horizon theme & “My Home”: align theming/accessibility with Horizon (themes) and plan adoption of My Home.

3) Post-technical-upgrade foundation & activation

Rapid Activation for S/4HANA 2023: run the foundational and role activation task lists (e.g., SAP_FIORI_FOUNDATION_S4) per help guide. From 2023 FPS01 you can launch activation directly from Content Manager → Services → STC02 (how-to).

Replicate app descriptors: for classic UIs exposed in FLP, run the backend→frontend descriptor replication as advised (guide).

Recalculate the UI5 Application Index: schedule /UI5/APP_INDEX_CALCULATE after changes and regularly via SM36 (scheduling, KBA 2449635).

Invalidate caches (only once, in order): follow SAP’s cache cleanup guidance for UI2, OData metadata, etc. (KBA 2319491).

4) Catalogs, roles, and Spaces/Pages remediation

Amend roles & catalogs: remove obsolete apps, add successors (see “Upgrade Faster” articles on the Fiori for S/4HANA topic page).

Migrate Groups → Spaces/Pages: adopt SAP-delivered Spaces/Pages per business role, or design your own (migration blog).

5) Custom UI5 app remediation & regression testing

UI5 compatibility: lint and test your apps against UI5 1.120 LTS (1.120 version info, maintenance overview).

Horizon & Spaces validation: retest routing, FLP parameters, and accessibility in Horizon and Spaces/Pages contexts.

Rebuild & transport: after BSP updates, re-run the UI5 app index (scheduling).

6) Validation & go-live readiness

What’s New / Deleted / Changed: review the official “What’s New” for 2023 (base release, FPS01).

FLP App Support tool: use App Support to diagnose config/authorization issues quickly (help).

Sources & further reading

SAP Fiori Apps Reference Library – home • Upgrade Impact Analysis (help) • blog

Readiness Check (Upgrades) – App Availability check overview

Spaces & Pages migration – why & how

Rapid Activation (2023) – help • Launch from Content Manager: learning

Replicate App Descriptors – help

SAPUI5 Application Index – scheduling • KBA 2449635

Cache cleanup after upgrades – KBA 2319491

Horizon theme – help • My Home – help

What’s New for S/4HANA 2023 – base • FPS01

UI5 versioning – UI5 1.120 • maintenance overview

App Support tool – help

Tip: Keep a runbook: apply foundational notes (per RIN), execute task lists, replicate descriptors, update UI5 index, invalidate caches once, and validate with App Support & What’s New.

entry.title: Guide for Inline Translations of Embedded SAC Stories in SAP Sales & Service Cloud V2 and SAP ESM
entry.content:
Embedded SAC stories in Sales & Service Cloud V2 and SAP ESM include a useful feature called Inline Translation. This feature allows customers to create and manage translations for story-related metadata during story creation or editing.

Inline Translation vs. Metadata Translation vs. Data Translation

It’s easy to mix up these three terms, so here’s a simple breakdown:

  • Inline Translation
    Refers to metadata created within an Embedded SAC Story. Examples include the story title, description, page titles, and widget titles. In short, anything you create inside the Embedded SAC environment.
  • Metadata Translation
    Applies to the metadata of Sales & Service Cloud V2 and SAP ESM—for example, the titles of data sources and their fields. This feature is not yet supported but will be available soon.
  • Data Translation
    Refers to translations of actual business data, such as code descriptions and extension code lists, in Sales & Service Cloud V2 and SAP ESM. This is already supported.

How to Enable Inline Translation

Enabling Inline Translation is a two-step process. Please note that this needs to be done for each story individually.

Step 1: Enable Translation for a Story

This is a one-time setup per story.

  1. Go to All Settings → Analytics → Design Stories.
  2. Select the story you want to translate and click Edit.
  3. In edit mode, click the gear icon under the File section, then select Story Details.
  4. In the pop-up window, turn on the Enable Translation toggle and click Save.
  5. After the pop-up closes, save the story again.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Important: The language you are logged in with becomes the source language for that story. This cannot be changed later. Make sure you log in with the correct language before enabling translations.

Step 2: Maintain Translations for Target Languages

This step must be repeated for every target language you want to support.

  1. Open the Embedded SAC story in Edit mode.
  2. From the menu, select Tools → Inline Translation (or More → Tools → Inline Translation).
  3. In the pop-up, choose the Target Language from the dropdown list.
  4. Update the text fields with the translated content. The source language text will appear by default.
  5. Click Done, then save the story.

 

 

 

 

 

 

What Business Users Will See

Once translations are maintained, your business users will automatically see story texts in the language they use to log in to Sales & Service Cloud V2 or SAP ESM.

entry.title: Re: OUTB Delivery - Picking Request Doc do not confirm
entry.content:
I guess, the picking confirmation is not passed properly in the FM you were using. Please note, the VBPOK_TAB table which you were referring must include

  • Picked quantity
  • Confirmed quantity
  • TAQUI = 'X' (Picking confirmation flag)

The delivery number (VBELN) in both VBPOK_TAB and VBKOK must match the Picking Request Document, not just the Outbound Delivery. This is a subtle but critical distinction. So check whether you are testing with the above correct parameters

entry.title: Finance Part1 - Bulgaria EUR Transition for S/4HANA Cloud Public Cloud Live Customers
entry.content:
This is only relevant for Partners and Live Customers who are required to transit Production system data with EUR adoption in Bulgaria. How To Guide Collection - Bulgaria EUR Transition for S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Live Customers

In the 5th session offered by ASC Cloud ERP Expertise Services, the main topic covered is around Finance (part 1)

  • Recording - Bulgaria EUR Transition for Live Customers (Finance Part1)
  • Presentation - Bulgaria EUR Transition for Live Customers (Finance Part1)  
  • Accelerator Guide
    • Finance - SSCUI and Application Checklist
    • Pre-defined Selection Variants (Finance AP_AR)
    • Migration of Asset Accounting Master Data and Postings
    • Migration of G/L Account Balance and Open Line Items

Key Discussion Points‌

1. Master Data Migration‌

  • ‌GL Accounts‌: Extend to the new EUR company code via Manage GL Account Master Data (batch copy limited to 500 accounts).
  • ‌Bank Accounts‌: Manually configure in all systems (dev/test/prod) using Manage Bank Accounts. Extend House Banks in all systems to new company code using Manage Banks – Cash Management
  • ‌Cost Centers/Profit Centers‌: Reuse existing codes or migrate via cockpit, adjusting validity periods.

‌2. Configuration Checks (SSCUI)‌

  • Mandatory settings include:
    • Currency configuration (reference currency must be EUR, not BGN).
    • Local Chart of Accounts assignment to new company code
    • Default account assignments (for automatic postings on revenue/expense accounts).
    • Payment methods and bank determination rules for AP/AR.
    • Cash Journal

‌3. Transactional Data Migration‌

  • ‌AP/AR‌: Clear open items, extract data via Manage Supplier/Customer Line Items, and migrate using templates.
  • ‌GL Balances‌: Migrate only open-item-managed accounts for open line item migration; migrate balances for non-open item managed GLs separately. Reconcile tax/GIR accounts before migration and settle open tax items.
  • ‌Down payments‌: Recreate requests in the new company code and clear payments manually.

‌4. Post-Cutover Activities‌

  • Disable BGN bank statements and enable EUR statements – bank to include new bank accounts in MBC list.
  • Retain limited access to the old company code for audit adjustments.

Live Questions & Answers

Topic Area‌

‌Question‌

‌Answer

Block Posting

How to lock the old company code? We do it somehow in the org structure or we block the possibility to make postings (which SSCUI can be used for that)?

You can block postings in the old company code by closing the posting periods with app "Manage Posting Periods".

  • Close the financial periods to avoid posting in the old company code.
  • Open the app Manage Posting Periods and select the posting period variant of the old company code and click on Go.
  • Select All the posting period variant items and click on the Set Posting Periods button. Assign the posting periods and save the changes

You can also block all GL accounts for posting in old company code in app "Manage GL Accounts Master Data"

  • Select the view “Company code view”, add the old company code and click on Go.
  • Select all the G/L accounts and click on the Mass Change button and select other attributes.
  • In the new screen Mass Change in Company Code View, select in the Blocked for postings “Replace – All” and “By – Yes”. Click on the Apply button.
  • Click on the Save button once you confirm the changes in the Items table.

Org Structure

We have created the new company code recently. We saw that the old one in the org structure has a tick for "Default company code for the country" - at what point this tick is moved to the company code and by whom - SAP or us?

As explained in KBA 3580645 - Default Company Code checkbox in SAP Central Business Configuration's Organizational Structure - SAP for Me its purpose is purely for technical reasons. This setting is assigned once per country with the first company code that is activated for that country to have technical information about initial deployments between CBC and S/4.

There are no business impacts regarding company code and currency operations, neither any impacts during upgrades or updates.

Furthermore, we can also note that if the issue concerns to the default company code settings for end users, it should not be a concern. This is because the defaults for end users are entirely controlled through user settings.

Any other presence of the existing "old" company code in the system poses no risk, given that no users or accesses are assigned to it, and posting periods/posting variants are not maintained. Additionally, please rename the currency BGN company code to "do not use" for greater visibility.

Cost Center

A question regarding the cost centers and in particular their codes - as far as I understand we can still use the current cost center codes by copying them to the new company code, is that correct? What do to if there are transactional data posted or commitments?

That is correct. You can create a new validity period for them starting on 01.01.2026. But this will not be possible if there are any transactional data posted against the cost center. The cost center ID will stay as it was before.

Plan data could be deleted. However, this is not possible for actuals/commitments.

In such a case you need to create new cost centers.

Transport

We are on 2SL. Are we going to copy old (in BGN) to new (in EUR) company code, is this going to be available?

Yes, if you are on CBC 2SL, similarly as for 3SL, except you do not have a Test system where you need to replicate master data or transport configurations. You only need to transport to Prod system

Call-to-Action

Register and Attend Upcoming Webinar presented by SAP Service experts with practical suggestions

  • Register Now [Sept 10th] Bulgaria EUR Transition for Live Customers (Finance Part2, Analytics)
  • Register Now [Sept 24th] Bulgaria EUR Transition for Live Customers (Sales, Q&A for all area)
  • please kindly bookmark this blog - How To Guide Collection - Bulgaria EUR Transition for S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Live Customers (with all accelerators, replay, upcoming session)

Please view all content and raise questions with tag #Bulgaria

Mary

entry.title: SOST Transcation taking long time to open / Ending up with TIME OUT Dump
entry.content:
Issue  : 

  • It took very long time to display the send requests in SOST
  • Or it ended with following runtime error

          Category ABAP programming error
          Runtime Errors TIME_OUT
          ABAP Program SAPLSX11
          Application Component BC-SRV-COM

          Short Text
          Time limit exceeded

          What happened?
          Program "SAPLSX11" has exceeded the maximum uninterrrupted runtime and has
          therefore been terminated.

Cause : 

There are too many send requests in SAPConnect queue or SAPOffice tables contain huge amount of entries.

Resolution : 

Follow the SAP Note : 3164602 - It takes long time to open SOST or runtime error TIME_OUT occurs

Even if SAP Note solution doesn't work, Here is the solution :

Need to create secondary index to improve response time using below query : 

create index <SCHEMA>."SOES~<Index ID>" on <SCHEMA>."SOES" (MANDT, STATUS, SNDDAT, MSGTY)

Ex : create index SAPSR3."SOES~A1" on SAPSR3."SOES" (MANDT, STATUS, SNDDAT, MSGTY)

Note: Before implementing any changes directly in the Production system, always test them first in a Development or Quality environment. This helps ensure stability, prevents unexpected disruptions, and validates the solution safely.

entry.title: Re: What exactly is SAP BW PCE… and what it is not !
entry.content:
Dear Daljit,
BI-JAVA can also run in PCE for NetWeaver 7.50.
It is a separate Java server which has to be considered in the PCE deployment  as separate server (incl. its commercial impact). The lift&shift migration is able to also cover this component as well.
Regards Frank

entry.title: Re: Understanding HANA memory related license utilization in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
Dear @Grace2012 ,

Q1: how can customer monitor on the usage of RAM, you mentioned Health Monitoring of Cloud ALM, if in China, there is no Cloud ALM, how customer can check on this figure?

A1: On the S/4 tenant the app 'HANA Memory Analysis' can be used to track
a) the history of actively used memory broken down by 'memory consumers', e.g. column store / row store for the data footprint and 'DB management' for processing of queries.

b) the allocated memory, which is the basis for the license calculation (based on the 3rd highest peak of the last 30 days). The allocated memory is displayed as a line and refers to the axis on the right hand side. 

Q2. if contract max usage should be 200G, and customer useing to 220G, what will happened? whether system will be slow?

A2: There is no throttling mechanism to slow down the system on purpose. The required memory is provided to avoid system standstill and keep the system up and running, but the customer will no longer be compliant in terms of license usage and should get in touch with SAP.

entry.title: Sorting in Table with compact display doesn't work
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I’ve created a table using the optimized view and enabled the compact display with the following line:

Table1.setCompactDisplayEnabled(TableAxis.Rows,true);

 I’ve noticed that the option to sort the values in the table is no longer available.

Does anyone know how to enable sorting for a table in compact display mode?

Many thanks in advance for your help!

Best regards
